comments:
Writes hardware configuration, see command 58h.
According to Linux kernel source and the behavior of the Windows 3.1 SC400 drivers, command 6Ch must come immediately before this command, and after writing the two bytes must be followed with command C5h.

Noted in the Linux sc6000.c sc6000_init_board(), is that there are 'old' boards in which command 5Ch does not write configuration but instead returns a byte, see alternate 5Ch SC-6000 definition
Reads ???\n\nAccording to Linux sc6000.c sc6000_init_board(), older SC-6000 cards implement command 5Ch as something that returns a byte, rather than something that accepts hardware configuration.
Writes ???\n\nLinux sc6000.c writes 0x02 to this command

Unknown command at this time, but apparently written immediately before writing hardware configuration with command 5Ch.\n\nNoted behavior of both the Linux kernel sc6000.c and the SC400 Windows 3.1 drivers.

Unknown. Based on SC400 Windows 3.1 driver behavior at shutdown, this may be the counterpart to command 8Ch that disables the Microsoft Sound System.\n\nWhether it returns a byte is uncertain. SC400 Windows 3.1 drivers issue the command but do not read back anything. Linux sc6000.c issues this command and expects a byte to return, or else it fails the card.
According to Linux sc6000.c and Windows 3.1 driver behavior at startup, this enables the Microsoft Sound System interface.

Unknown command at this time, but apparently written immediately after writing hardware configuration with command 5Ch.\n\nNoted behavior of both the Linux kernel sc6000.c and the SC400 Windows 3.1 drivers.
